Supported by:
| style="background:#efefef" |  Libyan Arab Jamahiriya
| style="background:#D0FFD0" | Victory
* Complete overthrow and collapse of the Gaddafi regime.
* Killing of Muammar Gaddafi and end of his rule over Libya on 20 October 2011
* Start and continuation of the Libyan Crisis
* Assumption of interim control by National Transitional Council; remained in power until August 8, 2012
* UN authorisation of NATO led military intervention
* Diplomatic recognition of NTC as sole governing authority for Libya by 105 countries, UN, EU, AL and AU
* Factional violence in the aftermath of the war leading to another civil war in 2014
